title: As a user I want to be able to run the Rookie Career Development Report
custom_steps:
Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Rookie+Career+Development+Report+Layout

Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Rookie+Career+Development+Report+Details

Report Logic: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=118479988

Report Prompts: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Rookie+Career+Development+Program+Report+-+Prompts

View Story: #151620926

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "Rookie Career Development" is a report in the Report listing widget. Selecting this report from the widget will launch the prompts according to the requirements. 
* The category of this report should be "Pro Player Management". 
* Entering the desired prompts and running the report will work and match the requirements. 
* The report will have an LDAP associated with it. Please provide the LDAP when the story is delivered and a user id to test the report and security with.

title: As a BOC user I want to filter for Special Rosters on the Pending Approvals widget
custom_steps:
'AC:
- Special Rosters is an option under the Misc filter on the Pending Approvals widget

title: As a user I want the Declare MN Free Agent batch to be faster
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* Run took 3 hours in production but this could be faster if we don't run the service calc as part of the batch process. 
* This story is to  make that update and make sure the batch still works as expected with the change.

title: Rework the way batch screen refreshes during batch runs
custom_steps: Right now, the automatic refreshing of the widgets on the batch screen makes it pretty unusable during the time a batch is running.  we can probably streamline this to have the progress bar continue to update often, but have the other sections update less often or on demand, making it usable.

title: As a user, I want to run the Lookup API batch to update the lookups cached in Couchbase
custom_steps:
'Acceptance criteria:
- A batch named 'Lookup API Load' should exist in Utilities -> Batches -> General.
- Running the Lookup API Load batch should insert/update/delete Lookup API objects in Couchbase to align Couchbase's lookup records with those in the EBIS database.

title: Add mobile styling to form headers to avoid text wrapping to 2 and 3 lines
custom_steps: On mobile sized devices long form titles wrap.  Let's ellipsis the form title when there isn't sufficient space.

title: As a User, I want to edit the Signing Scout info on a Domestic Amateur Profile
custom_steps:
'**AC**
- The Signing scout field on the Domestic Amateur Player Profile should be editable by any club user or BOC user with domestic amateur player profile edit permissions.
- If no value exists from ebis1, it should be blank.
- Club users can edit only if the field is blank. Once populated and saved, the field is only editable by BOC users but is locked to club users.
- A club user can only pick from a dropdown showing current Employees from their Org.
- A BOC users sees a list of all current Employees
- This should be a multi-select dropdown with search

title: As a user I want to be able to edit a player's Signing Scout info
custom_steps:
'**AC**
- The Signing scout field on the Player profile Draft and Scouting tab should be editable by any club user or BOC user with player profile edit permissions (Edit/Save functionality and permissions being built out by LL team).  
- Club users can edit only if the field is blank. Once populated and saved, the field is only editable by BOC users but is locked to club users.
- A club user can only pick from a dropdown showing current Employees from their Org.
- A BOC users sees a list of all current Employees
- This should be a multi-select dropdown with search

Original:
https://jira.boc.mlb.com:8443/browse/EBISII-11121#comment-51959

title: As a user I want to be able to see MLB Program Participation on a player's Scouting & Draft tab
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria: 
* The "MLB Program Participation" section should be moved from the "International" tab of Professional Player profiles to the "Scouting & Draft" tab. 
* This subsection should go below Rule 5 Draft section.

title: As a user I want to be able to edit a player's Scouting & Draft tab
custom_steps:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=118469167

Acceptance Criteria: 
* BOC users see an Edit button on the Scouting & Draft tab. 
* The event "Prospect Development Pipeline" should be added as an option for the MLB Program Participation event/program field. 
* The "Years Participated" field should be adjusted so that it is set to 2007 - Current +2, instead of its current logic.

title: MLBPA API LDAP Group
custom_steps:
AC:
 - There should be one LDAP group that controls access to the three MLBPA APIs
  - Rosters
  - Transactions
  - Waivers
 - This LDAP group should be assigned to a newly created MLBPA specific test account

title: As a user I want to be able to print the Service tab of a professional player profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=printing

Acceptance Criteria: 
* If a user has permission to see a player profile, then they see a Print button on the profile.
* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the player's Service tab. 
* The pdf will ONLY display what the logged in user has permission to see on the Service tab within the app. 
* The width of the info should be limited to one page, with text wrapping as necessary. 
* The top of the pdf should contain the Player's Roster Name, Middle Initial, Last Name, baseball position, Club/Org, MLS, MJ and MN roster status and Player ID.

title: As a user I want to be able to print the CSP tab of a professional player profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=printing

Acceptance Criteria: 
* If a user has permission to see a player profile, then they see a Print button on the profile.
* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the player's CSP tab. 
* The pdf will ONLY display what the logged in user has permission to see on the CSP tab within the app.
* If the user doesn't have CSP/CEP permissions, they will not see the option in the print modal.
* If the player doesn't have a CSP/CEP, the option will not appear in the print modal.
* The width of the info should be limited to one page, with text wrapping as necessary. 
* The top of the pdf should contain the Player's Roster Name, Middle Initial, Last Name, baseball position, Club/Org, MLS, MJ and MN roster status and Player ID.
